explains: n. （尤指为政府或机构）采购，购买；取得，获得；
wordGroup: government procurement 政府采购业务
procurement contract 采购合同；订货合同；采办合同

sentences.en: In recent years, the Southern California region has improved building codes, evacuation procedures, and procurement of new technology.
sentences.cn: 近年来，南加州地区改进了建筑规范、疏散程序和新技术采购。

sentences.en: Reducing waste by incorporating used materials into production can cut costs and decrease the price of procurement: less to be procured from the outside and more to be re-utilized from the inside.
sentences.cn: 通过将使用材料投入生产来减少浪费可以降低成本、减少采购花费：不从外部采购，更多从内部再利用。

sentences.en: Russia was cutting procurement of new weapons "by about 80 percent," he said.
sentences.cn: 他说俄罗斯正“以大约百分之八十的幅度”削减新武器的补给。
